main event: A radar-observed oval-shaped object flew at high speed over Colorado Springs, Colorado in 1962.
interesting points: The object was oval-shaped and approximately 35 feet in diameter and 10 feet high.
The object had a reddish-yellow exhaust and flew at an estimated speed of 1,500 mph.
The object passed in front of the moon on a south-easterly course, then went straight up and disappeared.
The sighting was visually observed for 4-5 seconds.
The observer was a former Civil Air Patrol squadron commander with 1,322 hours of flying experience.
witnesses: former Civil Air Patrol squadron commander
